Help! No sound after upgrading to Karmic: any pointers (I'm googling)
I've deleted the .pulse dir and .pulse-cookie file and restarted pulse audio using killall, but that doesn't seem to have made a difference.
im definitely no a sound expert but have heard reports that running alsamixer reviled a muted device
I get alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such file or directory
what kernel are you running ... uname -r
2.6.28-12-generic
lsb_release -c
updated manually from jaunty to karmic
looks like you are running an old kernel which may have bugs.... sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
I've just upgraded ... the kernel would nave have been updated?
that is a jaunty kernel .... you should be running 2.6.31-14-generic
that command did not update the kernel.
does lsb_release -c return karmic?
yes
sudo apt-get install linux-image-generic
that seems to be doing it ... on this topic, how do I get rid of old kernel installations? I've got 10-15 kernel images installed and I just want to keep the last 5 or so.
sudo apt-get autoremove
that should remove all the packages that are no longer needed including old kernels from previous installations
oh, nice.  thx
